body_html:
The problem with 1. is that if the number of shapes you're using is larger than the cache size your program will keep benchmarking forever (if I understood that correctly).

I think 2. is a great idea, but it would still be the best with a mode that forcefully disables benchmarking after some time if it doesn't give you any speedups (i.e. the cache would have to be huge, there are too many too rare combinations).

body:
The problem with 1. is that if the number of shapes you're using is larger than the cache size your program will keep benchmarking forever (if I understood that correctly).

I think 2. is a great idea, but it would still be the best with a mode that forcefully disables benchmarking after some time if it doesn't give you any speedups (i.e. the cache would have to be huge, there are too many too rare combinations).
